result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Clarence Paulson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William Clarence Paulson in court, in custody of MRSO.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for William Clarence Paulson.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
3:58 p.m.
Deft wishes to have prelim.
ADA calls Lt Matthew Borths, City of Marinette Police Dept - sworn in and examined.
Witness identifies Deft.
Shown Exhibit #1 - Complaint 22CF224 - offered and received.
Atty Spansail cross-examines.
ADA makes argument.
Atty Spansail makes argument.
Court finds probable cause.
Deft bound over for trial.
Arraignment already scheduled.
4:06 p.m.
Request for In Custody In Person Appearance at Preliminary Hearing

8:50 AM Defendant William Clarence Paulson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 22CF224 and 22CF234.
Court inquires on atty.
Deft heard - has recently been appointed Atty Spansail.
Atty Spansail is present and is heard - was just appointed Friday.
Requests prelim within time limits.
DA heard.
Deft has not had an initial appearance on 22CF234.
Court reviews charges on that case.
Deft understands.
Atty Spansail requests prelim be scheduled on both cases within time limits.
Court schedules.
DA heard on bond recommendation for 22CF234.
Atty Spansail heard.
Court imposes $5,000 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no operating a motor vehicle without a valid license, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid Rx, no entry into any bars or taverns, Compliance with Soberlink.
8:58 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Arraignment scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
8:47 AM Defendant William Clarence Paulson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mitchell Philbin in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 22CF224 and 22CF234.
Atty Hansen is present and is heard.
Deft qualifies, but no atty appointed yet.
Court schedules with parties.
8:48 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:37 AM Defendant William Clarence Paulson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Spansail is present from PD's office for bond purposes only.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Atty Spansail heard - has reviewed charges and penalties with Deft.
Deft understands.
Court inquires on Atty.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Spansail heard on bond.
Deft heard - has previously had Judge Morrison as an Atty on a civil case back in the 90's.
Court heard - does not remember this Deft or that case at all.
Atty Spansail speaks with Deft off record.
Deft would like to proceed today as scheduled.
Court imposes $5,000 cash bond w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today w/o a valid Rx.
Deft to contact the Public Defender today.
Court schedules with parties.
9:44 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
